availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Archibald A. Glenn (Brown County, Illinois, circuit court clerk)

body.p: Brown County, Illinois, circuit court clerk. Kentucky native. Married to Lavinia Cooper Glenn on February 13, 1851. Father of Ella Glenn, Florence Glenn, and Willie Glenn. Clerk of the Brown Circuit Court in Mount Sterling, Illinois, in 1860. Clerk of the Brown Circuit Court in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Illinois, Brown County, Mount Sterling, p. 667.
Sons of the American Revolution Membership Applications, 1889-1970. Louisville, Kentucky: National Society of the Sons of the American Revolution, National number 33306, State number, 332.
KYR-0001-022-0002.
